t: Exodus 27
The Altar of Burnt Offering
“You*p shall make an altar of acacia wood, five cubits long and five cubits wide—the altar shall be square—and its height shall*i be*i three cubits.
You shall make its horns on its four corners; its horns shall be of one piece with it. And you shall overlay it with bronze.
Also you shall make its pans to receive its ashes, and its shovels and its basins and its forks and its firepans; you shall make all its utensils of bronze.
You shall make a grate for it, a network of bronze; and on the network you shall make four bronze rings at its four corners.
You shall put it under the rim of the altar beneath, that the network may be midway up the altar.
And you shall make poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with bronze.
The poles shall be put in the rings, and the poles shall be on the two sides of the altar to bear it.
You shall make it hollow with boards; as it was shown you on the mountain, so shall they make it.*i
The Court of the Tabernacle
“You*p shall also make the court of the tabernacle. For the south side there*i shall*i be*i hangings for the court made*i of*i fine woven linen, one hundred cubits long for one side.
And its twenty pillars and their twenty sockets shall*i be*i bronze. The hooks of the pillars and their bands shall*i be*i silver.

Likewise along the length of the north side there*i shall*i be*i hangings one hundred cubits*i long, with its twenty pillars and their twenty sockets of bronze, and the hooks of the pillars and their bands of silver.
“And*p along the width of the court on the west side shall*i be*i hangings of fifty cubits, with their ten pillars and their ten sockets.
The width of the court on the east side shall*i be*i fifty cubits.
The hangings on one*i side of*i the*i gate*i shall*i be*i fifteen cubits, with*i their three pillars and their three sockets.
And on the other side shall*i be*i hangings of fifteen cubits,*i with*i their three pillars and their three sockets.

“For*p the gate of the court there*i shall*i be*i a screen twenty cubits long, woven*i of*i blue, purple, and scarlet thread,*i and fine woven linen, made by a weaver. It shall*i have*i four pillars and four sockets.
All the pillars around the court shall have bands of silver; their hooks shall*i be*i of silver and their sockets of bronze.
The length of the court shall*i be*i one hundred cubits, the width fifty throughout, and the height five cubits, made*i of*i fine woven linen, and its sockets of bronze.
All the utensils of the tabernacle for all its service, all its pegs, and all the pegs of the court, shall*i be*i of bronze.
The Care of the Lampstand
“And*p you shall command the children of Israel that they bring you pure oil of pressed olives for the light, to cause the lamp to burn continually.

In the tabernacle of meeting, outside the veil which is*i before the Testimony, Aaron and his sons shall tend it from evening until morning before the Lord.*s It*i shall*i be*i a statute forever to their generations on behalf of the children of Israel.
